channel.title: Teches on Xiang Li's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Teches on Xiang Li's Blog

item.title: Tensorflow2 learning note - Part 2
item.description: In the second part of this Tensorflow2 mini-series, I will write about how to make use of the pre-trained and well-established deep learning models to perform new tasks.

item.title: Tensorflow2 learning note - Part 1
item.description: Recently I have been taking a series of online courses to learn Tensorflow2, simply out of curiosity to know how it works, especially nowadays when almost everyone is talking about AI, deep learning, etc.

item.title: Interpret limit sets
item.description: In the statistics textbooks or papers, one would encounter many theorems and problems that are studying the limiting behavior of a series of random variables, for example, suppose \(X, X_1,…,X_n,…\) are random variables defined on a probability space, a question often asked is, what is the probability of the event that \(\lim_{n}X_n = X\)?

item.title: Use Python in R
item.description: As a statistician, I use R a lot in my school works and collaboration projects, since R provides almost all the statistical analysis tools I would need in my research, from data wrangling, statistical modeling, simulation, to data visualization.

item.title: Decompose correlation matrix with block structure
item.description: I recently read an interesting paper1 about how to sample from multivariate normal distribution with less computational complexity, and I really like the part where they make use of the block structure of the correlation matrix to conduct the eigen-decomposition.

item.title: Understand slicing in python 3d-arrays
item.description: I was having a hard time understanding the slicing along different axes of a 3d-array in python.

item.title: What happens if toss a fair coin infinite times?
item.description: Suppose we have a fair coin with two faces Head (H) and Tail (T).

item.title: Website Configuration
item.description: This is an ongoing post. The website is powered by Hugo, employing the theme Anatole.

item.title: Troubleshooting List
item.description: This is an ongoing post. 1. conda not found (Anaconda) This error occurs when running conda command on terminal after upgrading MacOS to Catalina.
